courses.name: Topics in Health Professions
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in Health Professions. Particular topics and credit may vary each semester.

courses.name: Leadership in Health Care
courses.description: This course will cover a broad range of concepts in leadership and professional development.  Focus will be placed on knowledge and skills necessary for effective leadership in the Health Professions.  The first of two semesters series.  Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.recommendation: to students in specified leadership programs

courses.name: Topics in Health Professions
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in health professions. Particular topics and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester.

courses.name: Special Readings in Health Professions
courses.description: Directed study of literature and research reports in the health-related professions.

courses.name: Human Kinesiology
courses.description: (same as PH_THR 4250 and OC_THR 4250). Study of principles of physical laws, biomechanics and anatomic structure relative to human movement. Application through analysis of daily functional performance, exercise and sport.

courses.name: Health Policy for the Health Professional
courses.description: Seminar to facilitate understanding of health policy, the legislative process, and politics. Emphasis on health professions, including issues of workforce, funding, and advocacy in the context of current health policy issues.

courses.name: Research Apprenticeship in Health Professions
courses.description: This course provides undergraduate students in the health professions and related disciplines experience with research in the health professions and related disciplines experience with research in the health professions.  Students will assist in the development and execution of research projects under the supervision of an SHP faculty member.

courses.name: Topics in Health Professions
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in health and/or healthcare. Topic and credit may vary from semester to semester.

courses.name: Health Care in the United States
courses.description: Overview of financing, structure, and outcomes in the U.S. health care system. Contemporary health care issues, policy, and politics will be addressed. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Health Policy for the Health Professional
courses.description: Seminar to facilitate understanding of health policy, the legislative process, and politics. Emphasis on health professions, including issues of workforce, funding, and advocacy in the context of current health policy issues.

courses.name: Topics in Health Professions
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics in health and/or healthcare. Topic and credit may vary from semester to semester.

courses.name: Problems in Health Professions
courses.description: Individual study not leading to thesis or dissertation.
